task.name: plot3d
task.shortdescription: Quickly inspect data for RFI by plotting time vs frequency vs amplitude.
task.description:
This program is designed to retain peak amplitudes of RFI spikes while performing data compression to speed up plotting. Your MS remains read-only throughout this program.
If your data contains multiple scans, gaps between scans will be reset to 5 integration timescales.
Christopher A. Hales Version 1.1 (tested with CASA Version 4.2.1) 4 August 2014
Code available at: http://github.com/chrishales/plot3d PLOT3D is released under a BSD 3-Clause Licence; refer to the header in task_plot3d.py for details.
THIS TASK ASSUMES THE FOLLOWING: * The end channel of each spw has been flagged. This will make the plots look nicer (you should be flagging these channels anyway). * The integration time is constant throughout the MS. * The first timestamp in each scan has been flagged (you should be quacking these anyway). * When plotall=T, each spw has the same number of channels. * Any differences in amplitudes between strong and weak baselines for your target are smaller than the typical RFI spikes you are interested in finding. This program will select the maximum amplitude on any baseline for a given time stamp. This is unlikely to be an issue, as it would require that peak RFI amplitudes on your weakest baseline are smaller than typical amplitudes on your strongest baseline, which would require an amazing (unrealistic?) dynamic range in amplitude vs uvdistance. If you are unsure, plot amplitude vs uvdistance for your target.

param.name: timecomp
param.description: number of time samples to compress (1 = no compression)

param.name: chancomp
param.description: number of channels to compress (1 = no compression)

param.name: clipamp
param.description: clip amplitude (set negative for no clipping)

param.name: outpng
param.description: export plot to png image? (automagic name generation)

task.example:
----- Detailed description of keyword arguments -----
Keyword arguments:
Most arguments are self explanatory. Some are a bit quirky, but that's how things are done here in the southwest (or maybe that's just me). Get in, take a look, and get out. No bells and whistles.
timecomp -- Number of timestamps to compress. For values N>1, this program will combine N integration cycles and store their maximum amplitude. Increasing N will make plot manipulation faster.
chancomp -- Number of channels to compress. For values M>1, this program will combine M channels and store their maximum amplitude. Increasing M will make plot manipulation faster.
